snippet: The emergence of same-sex marriage as a mainstream issue in less than a generation has upended convention, with public attitudes changing far more rapidly than on past social movements.
abstract: Pres Obama's endorsement of marriage equality reflects the accelerating pace of social change in the United States; public support for the legality of gay marriage has increased by 26 percent in the past decade.
lead_paragraph: The emergence of same-sex marriage as a mainstream issue in less than a generation has upended convention, with public attitudes changing far more rapidly than on past social movements.
